headline.main: DAMAGED SHIP LOST; Carrier Badly Crippled Monday Later Sunk by U.S. Warship

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 31 -- The Navy announced in a communique tonight the sinking of another American aircraft carrier in the Battle of the Solomons, the fourth to go down in the Pacific since the war started on Dec. 7. The Navy said the lost carrier was the one previously reported severely damaged in a battle with strong enemy forces northeast of Guadalcanal on Monday (Solomons time) when the United States destroyer Porter was sunk.
abstract: Solomon Islands: US plane carrier revealed sunk by US ship following irreparable damage by Jap attacks, near Santa Cruz Is; new Jap naval moves believed imminent; map
